definitions.definition: To set apart for a deity or for religious purposes; consecrate .
To set apart for a special use.
examples: dedicated their money to scientific research.

definitions.definition: To commit (oneself) to a particular course of thought or action.
examples: dedicated ourselves to starting our own business.

definitions.definition: To address or inscribe (a literary work, for example) to another as a mark of respect or affection.
To open (a building, for example) to public use.
To show to the public for the first time.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To set apart for a deity or for religious purposes; consecrate .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To set apart for a special use.
( transitive ) To commit (oneself) to a particular course of thought or action.
( transitive ) To address or inscribe (a literary work, for example) to another as a mark of respect or affection.
( transitive ) To open (a building, for example) to public use.
( transitive ) To show to the public for the first time.
